==Descriptions==
{{Description|There are neither coveted treasures nor gem-laden chambers at the pinnacle of the [[Mausoleum of King Deshret]] — only the desolation and decay of the desert, and the shreds of a grand dream.|Viewpoint, [[Viewpoint/Aaru's Shut|Aaru's Shut]]}}

==Trivia==
{{Transclude|Aaru Village|Etymology}}
* The word "shut" in the name derives from the Egyptian word {{Lang|mini=1|egy=𓈙𓅱𓏏𓋼|egy_rm=šwt}} meaning "shadow." This word can also figuratively refer to a reflection or refer to a person's {{w|Ancient Egyptian conception of the soul#Shut (shadow)|''shut''}} (shadow).
